content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is how you can define such function in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)::String
    # lowercase the column name
    col = lowercase(col);
    
    # replace all spaces and hyphens with underscores
    col = replace(col, " " => "_");
    col = replace(col, "-" => "_");
    
    return col;
end
```
This function takes a string `col` as input, converts it to lowercase using the `lowercase()` function, then replaces all spaces and hyphens with underscores. The modified string is then returned. 

Here are some examples:
```julia
println(clean_column("My Column")); # prints "my_column"
println(clean_column("Another-Column")); # prints "another_column"
println(clean_column("Last_column")); # prints "last_column"
```
